title: Slow Days
text:
Slow Days () is a 2006 <a href="black%20and%20white">black and white</a> <a href="Croatia">Croatia</a>n <a href="Independent%20film">indie</a> film. Set in the Croatian capital <a href="Zagreb">Zagreb</a> and its satellite town, <a href="Velika%20Gorica">Velika Gorica</a>, it follows the lives of over twenty individuals. It was directed, written, and edited over a period of three years by the young <a href="Matija%20Klukovi%C4%87">Matija Kluković</a> and starred, among others, Višnja Pešić, Filip Šuster, Marija Kohn, Petra Težak, and Nina Benović.
In Croatia, the film received critical acclaim for its independent style of film-making, terrific cast of non-actors combined with professional actors, and black and white cinematography by Bojana Burnać, the first female <a href="cinematographer">cinematographer</a> in Croatian film history. It won the Golden Pram award at <a href="Zagreb%20Film%20Festival">Zagreb Film Festival</a> and internationally premiered at the <a href="International%20Film%20Festival%20Rotterdam">International Film Festival Rotterdam</a> in 2007.
